label: AB3C_hR5_160_a_b_a-001
title: Rhombohedral BaTiO$_{3}$ Structure
comments:
The perovskite BaTiO$_{3}$ undergoes a variety of temperature driven phase transitions. (Shirane, 1957) 
 The first three structures are ferroelectric: \begin{itemize} \item Below 193K the structure is rhombohedral. (This structure) \item Between 193K and 278K the structure is \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_oC10_38_a_ae_b-002}{orthorhombic}. \item Between 278K and 393K the structure is \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_tP5_99_b_ac_a-001}{tetragonal}. This is the room-temperature form of the material. \item Above 393K the compound is a \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_cP5_221_a_c_b-001}{cubic perovskite ($E2_{1}$)}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_hP30_194_bf_hk_af-001}{Hexagonal BaTiO$_{3}$} can be stabilized by alloying the titanium sites with other transition metals. (Dickson, 1961) The pure structure has been grown at 1853K and cooled to room temperature. (Akimo, 1994) 
 The data was taken at 77.4K. 
 Rhombohedral BaTiO$_{3}$ is isostructural with \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_hR5_160_a_a_b-002}{$\gamma$-KNO$_{3}$} and \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_hR5_160_a_a_b-001}{KBrO$_{3}$ ($G0_{7}$)}, but the structural parameters are sufficiently different to warrant adding another structure to the database. 
 Space group $R3m$ \#160 does not specify the origin of the $z$-axis.  We follow (Hewat, 1974) and place the origin so that the titanium atom is at $1/2 c \hat{z}$. 
 Hexagonal settings of this structure can be obtained with the option {\tt --hex}.
